result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter Thomas Faust was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 3 years, as is the Defendant him/herself and device to be installed immediately; IID installation fee to be paid.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as recommended.

DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: MCJ with Huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination; No objection to EMP. 45 days to report

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter Thomas Faust

records.addlTxt: Emailed to NCHC
records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 3:30 pm.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Dave Casey.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to: 
Ct.2(Operating w/PAC (4th))>>DISMISSED.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to Ct.1(OWI (4th))>>GUILTY.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation; CONDITIONS: 90 days MCJ with huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination;  No objection to EMP.  Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as recommended.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 3 years, as is the Defendant him/herself and device to be installed immediately;  IID installation fee to be paid.  3 year DL revocation with any administrative credit.  AODA (unless already completed).  Maintain fulltime work/school or both.  Pay $600+CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 
45 days to report. 

COURT grants 4 days credit. 
Adj: 3:42 pm.
Final pre-trial on August 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

ADA Mayo appears
Atty Casey appears
FPT 8/31/22 @ 3:30 pm
Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
